title: MD-XGR--Immigrants-Health-Insurance-Maryland
headline: Maryland Senate passes bill to let people buy health insurance regardless of immigration status
headline_extended: People would be able to buy health insurance through Maryland’s health care exchange, regardless of their immigration status, under a bill approved by the state Senate
description_summary: People would be able to buy health insurance through Maryland’s health care exchange, regardless of their immigration status, under a bill approved by the state Senate. Senators voted 34-13 on Friday for the measure. The Maryland House already passed a similar version of the legislation. Each chamber would need to vote to approve the other’s to send the legislation to Gov. Wes Moore. The measure would require the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to submit a federal waiver application by July 1, 2025, to implement the program.

body_nitf:
ANNAPOLIS, Md. (AP) — People would be able to buy health insurance through Maryland's health care exchange, regardless of their immigration status, under a bill approved by the state Senate on Friday.

Supporters say the measure would reduce uncompensated hospital care costs and improve emergency room wait times.

The Senate voted 34-13 for the measure. The Maryland House already passed a similar version of the legislation. Each chamber would need to vote to approve the other's before the legislation can be sent to Gov. Wes Moore.

The measure would require the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to submit a federal waiver application by July 1, 2025, to implement the program. The waiver is needed because of federal restrictions on immigrants lacking permanent legal status using the marketplace. The program in Maryland could start as early as 2026, if a waiver is granted.

Health.reason: The document discusses a bill passed by the Maryland Senate that allows people to buy health insurance regardless of their immigration status. This directly pertains to the topic of health as it involves health insurance, healthcare access, and potential impacts on hospital care costs and emergency room wait times. The document provides specific details about the legislative process and the requirements for implementing the program, which are all relevant to the topic of health.
